wikipedia_page.main: Clive William Leach CBE (born 4 December 1934) is a former English cricketer. He was a right-handed batsman who bowled slow left-arm orthodox. He was born in Bombay, Bombay State, India.

response: Ward Thomas came out of retirement and returned to the Chairmanship of YTV in November 1993 after the company ran into difficulties under the stewardship of Clive Leach.Gail Counsell. "Thomas takes over at Yorkshire-Tyne Tees". The Independent. 9 November  1993. YTV's difficulties stemmed from overselling air-time to advertisers in 1992-3, this had to be honoured in the following year forcing the company to make provisions of £20.2m to cover the debt.Susan Gilchrist. "YORKSHIRE TV PLUNGES TO LOSS OF £7.9M". The Times. 29 January 1994. P21 When these resulted in pre-tax losses for the year of £7.9m, Ward Thomas was recalled from retirement to steer the company out of its predicament.Old hand reinstated in the hour of need - Ward Thomas at YTTV. Media Week. 19 November 1993. Upon his return to Yorkshire Ward Thomas demanded Clive Leach's resignation, proposed that the board waive all management bonuses and embarked on a programme of cost-cutting which returned the broadcaster to profit by the end of 1994.Lisa Buckingham. "THE BOSS IS BACK - YORKSHIRE TV". The Guardian. 17 October 1994. p26 In 1995, Ward Thomas appointed Bruce Gyngell as Managing Director."Yorkshire snaps up former TV-AM boss Bruce Gyngell". The Independent. 2 May 1995. p28 Having been brought in initially as a temporary measure to stabilise the company, Ward Thomas announced in March 1996 that the board had asked him to continue his time at the helm.Matt Baker. "Ward Thomas stays on for licence fight". Broadcast. 15 March 1996. p3
Dame Fanny Waterman, DBE was honorary president from 2009 until her death in 2020, the position having previously been held by Clive Leach CBE.
